div.p: The alternate resource provides the results of an evaluation for alternative treatements that may be suggested by the decision support service.

Similar to the result resource, the alternate resource enables the results of an evaluation to be returned. However, because the alternate is suggested by the decision support service, the constraints on what may appear are slightly different.

description.value: The alternate resource provides the results of an evaluation for alternative treatements that may be suggested by the decision support service.

requirements.value: Similar to the result resource, the alternate resource enables the results of an evaluation to be returned. However, because the alternate is suggested by the decision support service, the constraints on what may appear are slightly different.

definition.value: Basic is used for handling concepts not yet defined in FHIR, narrative-only resources that don't map to an existing resource, and custom resources not appropriate for inclusion in the FHIR specification.
An optional value which can be used to record a score associated with the evaluation process.

comments.value: The interpretation of this value may vary depending upon guidelines and Decision Support Service actors used.

requirements.value: This may be present to enable quality improvement efforts related to ordering.

definition.value: Indicates the period over which the evaluation is valid.

comments.value: Not required when manually issued, required otherwise.

requirements.value: This field SHALL be provided unless the evaluation was issued manually, in which case it is optional.
The services that are to be ordered SHALL be provided.

definition.value: A reference to the guidelines or policies under which the evaluation was created.

requirements.value: This field SHALL be provided unless the evaluation was issued manually, in which case it is optional

definition.value: A reference to the Device resource describing the Decision Support Service Actor.

requirements.value: This field SHALL be provided unless the evaluation was issued manually, in which case it is optional. This SHALL be a reference to one of the Devices specified in the dss parameter.

definition.value: An identifier representing the ordering practitioner.

requirements.value: This SHALL be provided unless the evaluation was issued manually, in which case it is optional.

definition.value: A digital signature over this resource
Identifier assigned to the resource for business purposes, outside the context of FHIR.

requirements.value: This is a business identifier associated with the evaluation for the order. It is a unique identifier issued by the evaluator associated with this transaction. An identifier SHALL be provided unless the code is “incomplete”, “cannot be evaluated” or “not covered”. Note that this identifier may be associated with multiple evaluations.

definition.value: Identifies the 'type' of resource - equivalent to the resource name for other resources.

comments.value: Because resource references will only be able to indicate 'Basic', the type of reference will need to be specified in a Profile identified as part of the resource. Refer to the resource notes section for information on appropriate terminologies for this code.

requirements.value: Must be able to distinguish different types of "basic" resources.

description.value: Codes for identifying types of resources not yet defined by FHIR

short.value: Identifies the focus of this resource

definition.value: Identifies the patient, practitioner, device or any other resource that is the "focus" of this resource.

comments.value: Optional as not all resources potential resources will have subjects. Resources associated with multiple subjects can handle this via extension.

requirements.value: Needed for partitioning the resource by Patient.
